The North China Plain extends from 112° to 122°E longitude and 32° to 42°N latitude, covering three provinces (Shandong, Hebei, and Henan) and two municipalities (Beijing and Tianjin; Fig. 8). Cotton is the largest cash crop by area in this region. This region exhibits average annual production of 2.07 million tons of cotton, accounting for 30.89% of China’s total cotton production from 2005 to 2014
20 . Therefore, in the context of climate change, investigating cotton phenology on the North China Plain is important for the stability of cotton production in China.
